title: Famous Musicians
desc: Find out if you are related to a famous musician.

people.name: Aretha Franklin
people.desc: Referred to as the Queen of Soul, Rolling Stone's 100 Greatest Artists of All Time.

people.name: Elvis Presley
people.desc: One of the most significant cultural figures of the 20th century.

people.name: Prince
people.desc: Singer and multi-instrumentalist, often preferring to play all or most of the instruments on his recordings. Prince produced his albums himself.

people.name: Michael Jackson
people.desc: The most awarded recording artist in pop music history.

people.name: Freddie Mercury
people.desc: Lead vocalist of the rock band Queen. Died at the age of 45 from AIDS.

people.name: Chuck Berry
people.desc: American singer, songwriter and guitarist who pioneered rock and roll. Wrote and sang Johnny B. Goode.

people.name: Jimi Hendrix
people.desc: One of the most influential electric guitarists in the history of popular music.

people.name: James Brown
people.desc: Central progenitor of funk music. One of the first 10 inductees into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame

people.name: Jerry Lee Lewis
people.desc: Singer songwriter of Great Balls of Fire. Career faltered when he married his 13-year-old cousin once removed.

people.name: Ray Charles
people.desc: Blind singer, songwriter, pianist and alto saxophonist. Became one of the first black musicians to be granted artistic control by a mainstream record company.

people.name: Johann Sebastian Bach
people.desc: Generally regarded as one of the greatest composers in the history of Western music. Orphaned at the age of 10.

people.name: Miles Davis
people.desc: American trumpeter, bandleader, and composer. Among the most influential figures in the history of jazz.

people.name: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart
people.desc: Mozart is widely regarded as among the greatest composers in the history of Western music. Died at the age of 35, circumstances of which are uncertain and much mythologized.

people.name: Louis Armstrong
people.desc: American trumpeter and vocalist. He was among the most influential figures in jazz.

people.name: Eddie Van Halen
people.desc: Co-founder, guitarist, keyboardist, backing vocalist, and primary songwriter of the rock band Van Halen.
